title: NT pokies clubs claim member perks, lavish upgrades as 'community' benefits | ABC NEWS
description: Community clubs in the Northern Territory claim they return millions in pokies profits to the community, but until now, what form those contributions took has been hidden from view.   Documents released to the ABC under Freedom of Information laws reveal much of it was actually spent upgrading the clubs' own hospitality venues and providing free perks for their members.   Some even claimed donations made by members of the public via charity tins on club bars which had no connection with their poker machine profits. The NT government says requiring community clubs to pay a 10 per cent cash levy like pubs and casinos may make some financially unviable.   Jason Walls has this report for Stateline Northern Territory.   Subscribe: http://ab.co/1svxLVE  ABC NEWS provides around the clock coverage of news events as they break in Australia and abroad. title: Victorians should brace for more property losses amid catastrophic fire risk: CFA | ABC NEWS
description: Properties have been lost in the Longwood fire in Central Victoria. title: Catastrophic fire danger in Victoria while Queensland braces for flooding rain | ABC NEWS
description: Hot and windy conditions are conspiring to create the most severe level of fire warnings in Victoria, with New South Wales to experience the heatwave over the weekend. Meanwhile, a tropical low could develop into a cyclone off the Queensland coast. Regardless of whether it becomes a cyclone or not, the system will bring heavy rain and strong winds to already-sodden catchments. title: Authors withdraw from Adelaide Writers' Week after Palestinian Australian author dropped | ABC NEWS
description: Authors including Miles Franklin winners Michelle de Kretser and Melissa Lucashenko will boycott Adelaide Writers' Week (AWW) to protest the cancellation of an event featuring Palestinian Australian author, lawyer and activist Randa Abdel-Fattah.  She was dropped by the Adelaide Festival Board, chaired by marketing executive Tracey Whiting. The board includes journalist Daniela Ritorto and Adelaide Airport managing director Brenton Cox, but no artists, following the departure of choreographer Stephen Page.  Adelaide Writers' Week is part of Adelaide Festival, but is led by director Louise Adler.  üìùHannah Story üé§Charles Brice üé¨Seena Katayama  ABC NEWS provides around the clock coverage of news events as they break in Australia and abroad. title: Bushfires threaten Victoria amid 'catastrophic' conditions | ABC NEWS
description: Authorities in Victoria and South Australia are on high alert as hot temperatures and strong winds bring "catastrophic" and "extreme" fire conditions to both states. Multiple out-of-control bushfires are threatening dozens of towns in central and north-eastern Victoria, while other parts of the country swelter through another day of a heatwave. Several properties have been destroyed, and emergency services say three people, including a child, are unaccounted-for after a house burned down in Longwood.  üìª ABC Emergency will broadcast regular warnings on ABC Radio. Make sure you have a battery-operated radio. üì± You can also find these stations on the ABC Listen App. üíª Check the ABC Emergency website for important tips and information.  Here are the frequencies you can tune into across Victoria as bushfires rage:  Goulburn Valley: 97.7 FM  Corryong: 99.7 FM  Upper Murray: 106.5 FM  Melbourne: 774 AM Alexandra: 102.9 FM  Mansfield: 103.7 FM  Eildon: 98.1 FM  ABC NEWS provides around the clock coverage of news events as they break in Australia and abroad.
